author: jleroux
msg: "Applied fix from trunk for revision: 1042411"  (conflicts resolved by hand)
A patch from Anne Jessel "Wrong product displayed as associated product" (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OFBIZ-4023) - OFBIZ-4023
To reproduce:
* add two associated products to a main product, both with "Complementary or Cross-Sell" association type
* view the main product in ecommerce
Expected behaviour: the two associated products are listed near the bottom of the page
Actual behaviour: two products are listed at the bottom of the page, but only one of them is an associated product. The other is the main product.
The problem is caused by the value of a freemarker variable changing at a point where other freemarker code assumes the variable does not change. The execution path is complicated.
The patch fixes the problem by saving the value of the key variable into another variable, and restoring it later. However I do wonder if there is a better solution.
JLR: I did not try to find a better solution

author: rwesten
msg: General Note:
Building of FISE is now dependent on RICK. That means you need first to build/install RICK before you can build/install FISE.
To build/install RICK please follow the first two steps described at http://wiki.iks-project.eu/index.php/RickInstallation#Building_the_RICK_Framework
Entity Tagging Engine
This is a FISE Enhancement Engine that uses a RICK Referenced Site for semantic lifting of TextAnnotations (text entities extracted by a NLP engine)
This engine supports multiple instances with different configuration.
Configurations include
- the ID of the referenced Site to use for semantic lifting
- if Persons, Organizations, Places are semantically lifted
- rdf:types used to search for Persons, Organizations, Places
- field used to search for the label
Note that this engine returns -1 as score if no score is available
Note about Clerezza Literals
Clerezza defines two implementations of the Literal interface
1) TypedLiteral: used for Literals with an xsd data type
2) PlainLiteralImpl: used for natural language texts with a language.

Within the FISE code Literal instances are created by using the LiteralFactory. However this Factory supports only TypedLiterals. Clerezza does not contain a Factory for PlainLiteralImpl. Also when converting TypedLiterals back to there Java Object representation the LiteralFactory requires a TypedLiteral Instance ( see LiteralFactory#createObject(Object,TypedLiteral) method). Therefore there it is very inviting to use a type cast for TypedLiteral when converting Literals to Java Objects.

For Literals that represent natural language text one should not use the LiteralFactory at all but directly call the Literal#getLexicalForm() method! FISE currently does only use TypedLiterals, therefore such bugs currently do not have any effect.
This commit corrects such a Code segment in the ContentItemResource. However the FISE code needs to be checked for other possible occurrences.
Launchers FULL
- added RICK to the full launcher
- added the RICK based Entity Tagging Engine to the FULL launcher
